name: Karl Kling
introduction: Karl Kling (born 16 September 1910 in Gieen, Gieen, Hesse, Germany  died 18 March 2003 in Gaienhofen, Freiburg, Baden-Wrttemberg, Germany) was a German racing driver who competed in Formula One in 1954 and 1955.  Serving as deputy to Juan Manuel Fangio, Kling scored two podiums and seventeen points.
